title: SHM - Graph of K vs t from graph of x vs t

content.question: Which of the following graphs correctly models the kinetic energy of the block as a function of time?

choices.label: The figure shows a sinusoidal curve with one full peak and two troughs in the first and fourth quadrants of a plane with the origin labeled O. The vertical axis is labeled Kinetic Energy and has no values along it. The horizontal axis is labeled Time and has the values T and 2 T indicated. The curve begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves down, crossing the horizontal axis at T over 4, reaching the first trough at T over 2, then going back up, crossing the horizontal axis at 3 T over 4 and reaching the full peak at T. The pattern repeats with crossings of the horizontal axis at 5 T over 4 and 7 T over 4 and a trough at 3 T over 2, reaching a new peak at 2 T. The peaks and troughs are the same distance from the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a sinusoidal curve with one full peak and two troughs in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The vertical axis is labeled Kinetic Energy and has no values along it. The horizontal axis is labeled Time and has the values T and 2 T indicated. The curve begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves down, reaching the horizontal axis at the first trough at T over 2, then going back up, reaching the full peak at T. The pattern repeats with a trough at 3 T over 2 and a new peak at 2 T.

The figure shows a sinusoidal curve with two peaks and two troughs in the first and fourth quadrants of a plane with the origin labeled O. The vertical axis is labeled Kinetic Energy and has no values along it. The horizontal axis is labeled Time and has the values T and 2 T indicated. The curve begins at the origin, goes up and reaches a peak at T over 4, goes back down, crossing the horizontal axis at T over 2, reaching the first trough at 3 T over 4, then going back up, crossing the horizontal axis at T. The pattern repeats with a peak at 5 T over 4, crossings of the horizontal axis at 3 T over 2 and 2 T and a trough at 7 T over 4. The peaks and troughs are the same distance from the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a repeated peak pattern in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The vertical axis is labeled Kinetic Energy and has no values along it. The horizontal axis is labeled Time and has the values T and 2 T indicated. Each peak starts and ends on the horizontal axis, spans a width of T/2, and reaches the same height on the vertical axis. There are four peaks between 0 and 2 T, with the peaks located at T over 4, 3 T over 4, 5 T over 4, and 7 T over 4 and reaching the horizontal axis at 0, T over 2, T, 3 T over 2, and 2 T.

content.answer: The figure shows a repeated peak pattern in the first quadrant of a plane with the origin labeled O. The vertical axis is labeled Kinetic Energy and has no values along it. The horizontal axis is labeled Time and has the values T and 2 T indicated. Each peak starts and ends on the horizontal axis, spans a width of T/2, and reaches the same height on the vertical axis. There are four peaks between 0 and 2 T, with the peaks located at T over 4, 3 T over 4, 5 T over 4, and 7 T over 4 and reaching the horizontal axis at 0, T over 2, T, 3 T over 2, and 2 T.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
